p: Many fungal strains have been found on wheat grains, including the genera Alternaria, Cladosporium, Drechslera, Epicoccum, Eurotium, Fusarium, and Penicillium [ 2, 3]. Besides the economic loss caused by fungi growing in stored grains, some of these species are mycotoxin producers. These toxins are dangerous to human health because they are responsible for many pathologies, among them cancer and allergies [ 4, 5].
